editorialNotes.standard: Swing, batta batta! Cheeky heckling and memorable stars make this remastered classic as fun as we remember.

ios.subtitle: Roll the Dice, Pass Go & Win

editorialNotes.standard: Animal Crossing: Pocket Camp lives on! This offline version of the beloved management sim includes all the original content, plus a few new surprises.

After a long day at work, it’s bath time! But Swampy’s shower is broken and he needs your help to guide the water to him. Navigate a path through the dirt past contraptions and obstacles to get every drop to fill the bath.

ios.subtitle: Take It To The Next Level

editorialNotes.tagline: Get a job and have kids with a spin

ios.subtitle: New Style of Air Hockey game.
Unlock the Magic Fish of Isola
Adopt a family in your pocket!
The family game of your life!

editorialNotes.standard: Ancient Egyptians loved cats, Metallica hasn’t played the Super Bowl, and the Ganges is India’s largest river—all our useless knowledge is now coming in handy thanks to Trivia Crack. This bite-sized trivia game is totally irresistible, whether we’re dominating our Facebook friends in classic mode, trouncing strangers in the 12-question challenge mode, or just sneaking in a game on our Apple Watch. With its cute characters, heaps of unlockable achievements, and a massive variety of questions, we simply can’t get enough.

An unforgettable adventure awaits in developer Thatgamecompany’s acclaimed hit Journey. Make your way to a distant mountain by skimming across sand dunes, scaling snowy cliffs, and exploring ancient ruins. Your magical scarf will power you over obstacles—though if you need a hand, link up with fellow travelers for fleeting moments of cooperative joy. Staggeringly beautiful and timelessly poignant, Journey is a trip well worth taking.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

name: Who Wants to Be a Millionaire?
artistName: Sony Pictures Television UK Rights Limited

ios.subtitle: Play the Official TV Game Show

editorialNotes.standard: A rare kind of triumph, Prune takes a simple idea—pruning trees—and shapes it into a creative, deeply playable puzzle game. The visuals echo the style of Japanese painting in striking fashion, and the beautiful music instills a contemplative tone as you swipe to trim the limbs of a rapidly growing tree and guide it around obstacles. There’s no frantic pace, no demanding skills to master—only a quietly bewitching and unforgettable experience.
editorialNotes.short: A contemplative and creative experience - trimming trees has never been so beautiful.

editorialNotes.standard: Baffling and wonderfully weird, Samorost 3 is so different from everyday adventure games that it’s impossible to describe what this amazing experience is actually like. We stumbled across brain teasers entirely by accident as we explored its eerie and beautiful world. There was no pressure to do anything other than marvel at what we found—which was easy.
editorialNotes.short: Wonderfully weird, this game blends adventure and brain teasers.

editorialNotes.standard: Zipping down snowy hills, trying to stay ahead of a massive avalanche—the pressure’s always on in this infinite-racing classic. And we love that whirlwind pace, fueled by landing backflips and hitching rides on penguins, snowmobiles, and yetis. From the game’s masterful one-touch controls to its cheery music, every aspect feels perfectly tuned to keep you playing through long afternoons and late nights.

You might get stuck the first time you play Gorogoa. But once the gears of your brain settle into the right configurations, you’ll see how smart this mix of art and perspective really is. Layers pile upon layers, doors transport you between realities, strange creatures and wild environments blend together into a fascinating interactive collage you’ll want to peel apart to discover what lies underneath.

name: Ice Hockey PRO: game for watch

editorialNotes.standard: Tap on almost anything in this stellar hidden object game and you might giggle when you realize voice actors supplied almost all the sound effects. Because the game has no time limit, you’re free to relax and fully explore every homespun level and discover all the strange and endearing secrets, like tapping on a snake to pop a chicken out of its mouth.
editorialNotes.short: Search for hidden people and objects in detailed, hand-drawn landscapes.

editorialNotes.standard: Bizarre doesn’t even begin to explain Young Horses’ laugh-out-loud game. You control a father who’s secretly an octopus, and moving the bendy protagonist around makes for hysterically madcap fun. You’ll slip, slap, and slide your way through stages stacked with objects for you to interact with—mostly by crashing into them. Octodad’s hilariously animated chaos is wacky and simply irresistible.
editorialNotes.short: Get married, raise some kids - but don't give away that you're an octopus.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: You can become a great artist!

name: Tsuro - The Game of the Path

editorialNotes.standard: This gorgeous digital board game couldn’t be any simpler to learn, but true mastery lies at the end of a long and winding path. As fans of Tsuro’s tabletop incarnation, we love how faithfully—and beautifully—the experience is re-created here. App-exclusive ways to play add new layers of depth, letting us get lost for hours among these tricky, twisty trails.

name: Abby Monkey Basic Skills Pre K
artistName: 22LEARN Toddler and Baby Learning Games, LLC

ios.subtitle: A story about love and life

editorialNotes.standard: There is a subtle beauty to Florence. This poignant love story intertwines a succinct narrative with smart interaction design to create moments of surprising emotional weight. Conversations are turned into puzzles that evolve as the characters’ moods shift. Memories fade into focus like old Polaroid photos. The way you touch the screen becomes just as important as the plot, which makes for a story you want to steer as well as follow. Florence fosters a rare sense of intimacy with its characters, creating an impression that lingers long after the story ends.
Scurry to victory with mountains of cheese by stealing from friends and evading the mousetrap in this lively digital reimagining of the popular board game.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

ios.subtitle: You'll play it again and again
Family fun @ home & on the go!
A tale of five tree creatures

editorialNotes.standard: What’s made OLO game one of our multiplayer favorites since 2012? The way it perfectly captures the friendly fun of real-world shuffleboard and air hockey. Virtually anyone can jump into a match (locally or online) and have an amazing time flicking discs into the target zone for points—and slyly knocking an opponent’s discs away to lower their score. Elegant and irresistible, Sennep’s all-ages masterpiece lets up to four players enjoy games that can be as casual or hardcore as everyone wants them to be.
Meditating on mortality and relationships is as important as hitting sweet shots in this beautifully atmospheric pinball game.

name: Eric Carle’s Brown Bear Animal Parade

ios.subtitle: The snake you know is back!

editorialNotes.standard: Ski Safari returns with an all-new look and the same addicting gameplay. Now you can hit the slopes as Sven's sister, Evana, boot up with a snowboard, and unlock all sorts of new power-ups. To outrun an impending avalanche you’ll need to crash through cabins, team up with Yetis and eagles, and perform tons of tricks. The gameplay is as fast-paced as ever, and a fresh multiplayer mode and colorful new worlds to explore (like a prehistoric volcano) will keep you cruising down these mountains for a long time.

editorialNotes.short: A puzzle adventure about flute-nosed creatures? Sure, why not.

name: THE GAME OF LIFE: Road Trip

editorialNotes.tagline: Twist on a classic board game

editorialNotes.standard: At a glance, hocus doesn’t look very complicated. You swipe to move a red cube along a latticework of plain gray beams. But don’t let the minimalist visuals fool you—the game’s intelligent, abstract puzzles force you to look at things in a new way, like a cubist translation of Monument Valley. As you progress, the levels quickly get complex. But the peaceful music and crisp design make spending time in its world a richly rewarding experience.

advisories: Infrequent/Mild Alcohol, Tobacco, or Drug Use or References

editorialNotes.standard: Three reasons you must play—or replay—LucasArts’ classic adventure: (1) The time-jumping story and quirky characters are as entertaining as ever. (2) So many clever puzzles and funny gags. (3) With beautifully updated graphics and sound, a slick new control scheme, and developer commentary, this remaster was clearly a labor of love.

name: Zoo Sounds - Fun Educational Games for Kids
The Very Hungry Caterpillar– First Words
